properties.name: Appid
properties.help: The Microsoft account ID (MSA ID) to be used with the bot.

properties.name: Kind
properties.help: The kind of the bot.

properties.name: Name
properties.help: The resource name of the bot. Bot name must be between 4 and 42 characters in length. Bot name can only have the following characters -, a - z, A - Z, 0 - 9, and _.

properties.name: Password
properties.help: The Microsoft account (MSA) password for the bot. Used to authorize messages being sent to the bot.

properties.name: ResourceGroup
properties.help: Name of resource group. You can configure the default group using `az configure --defaults group=&lt;name&gt;`.

properties.name: Location
properties.help: Location. Values from: `az account list-locations`. You can configure the default location using `az configure --defaults location=&lt;location&gt;`.

properties.name: Tags
properties.help: Space-separated tags in 'key[=value]' format. Use "" to clear existing tags.

properties.name: Description
properties.help: The description of the bot.

properties.name: DisplayName
properties.help: The display name of the bot. If not specified, defaults to the name of the bot.

properties.name: Endpoint
properties.help: The messaging endpoint of the bot.

properties.name: Sku
properties.help: The Sku of the bot.

properties.name: Echo
properties.help: Deploy an Echo Bot template to the newly created v4 Web App Bot.

properties.name: InsightsLocation
properties.help: WARNING: Not used in V4 bot creation. The location for the app insights to be used with the bot.  Default: South Central US.

properties.name: Lang
properties.help: The language to be used to create the bot.

properties.name: Storage
properties.help: WARNING: Not used in V4 bot creation. Storage account name to be used with the bot. If not provided, a new account will be created.

properties.name: Version
properties.help: The Microsoft Bot Builder SDK version to be used to create the bot.

properties.name: Subscription
properties.help: Name or ID of subscription. You can configure the default subscription using `az account set -s NAME_OR_ID`.

properties.name: Name
properties.help: The resource name of the bot. Bot name must be between 4 and 42 characters in length. Bot name can only have the following characters -, a - z, A - Z, 0 - 9, and _.

properties.name: ResourceGroup
properties.help: Name of resource group. You can configure the default group using `az configure --defaults group=&lt;name&gt;`.

properties.name: Subscription
properties.help: Name or ID of subscription. You can configure the default subscription using `az account set -s NAME_OR_ID`.

properties.name: Name
properties.help: The resource name of the bot. Bot name must be between 4 and 42 characters in length. Bot name can only have the following characters -, a - z, A - Z, 0 - 9, and _.

properties.name: ResourceGroup
properties.help: Name of resource group. You can configure the default group using `az configure --defaults group=&lt;name&gt;`.

properties.name: SavePath
properties.help: The directory to download bot code to.

properties.name: Subscription
properties.help: Name or ID of subscription. You can configure the default subscription using `az account set -s NAME_OR_ID`.

properties.name: Lang
properties.help: The language or runtime of the bot.

properties.name: CodeDir
properties.help: The directory to place the generated deployment files in. Defaults to the current directory the command is called from.

properties.name: ProjFilePath
properties.help: The path to the .csproj file relative to --code-dir.

properties.name: Subscription
properties.help: Name or ID of subscription. You can configure the default subscription using `az account set -s NAME_OR_ID`.

properties.name: Name
properties.help: The resource name of the bot. Bot name must be between 4 and 42 characters in length. Bot name can only have the following characters -, a - z, A - Z, 0 - 9, and _.

properties.name: ProjFilePath
properties.help: Path to the start up project file name. (E.g. "./EchoBotWithCounter.csproj") Required only for C#.

properties.name: ResourceGroup
properties.help: Name of resource group. You can configure the default group using `az configure --defaults group=&lt;name&gt;`.

properties.name: SlnName
properties.help: Name of the start up solution file name. Required only for C#.

properties.name: CodeDir
properties.help: The directory to download deployment scripts to.

properties.name: Version
properties.help: The Microsoft Bot Builder SDK version to be used in the bot template that will be created.

properties.name: Subscription
properties.help: Name or ID of subscription. You can configure the default subscription using `az account set -s NAME_OR_ID`.

properties.name: Name
properties.help: The resource name of the bot. Bot name must be between 4 and 42 characters in length. Bot name can only have the following characters -, a - z, A - Z, 0 - 9, and _.

properties.name: ResourceGroup
properties.help: Name of resource group. You can configure the default group using `az configure --defaults group=&lt;name&gt;`.

properties.name: CodeDir
properties.help: The directory to upload bot code from.

properties.name: KeepNodeModules
properties.help: Keep node_modules folder and do not run `npm install` on the App Service. This can greatly speed up publish commands for Node.js SDK bots.

properties.name: ProjFilePath
properties.help: Path to the start up project file name. (E.g. "./EchoBotWithCounter.csproj").

properties.name: Timeout
properties.help: Configurable timeout in seconds for checking the status of deployment.

properties.name: Version
properties.help: The Microsoft Bot Builder SDK version of the bot.

properties.name: Description

properties.name: DisplayName

properties.name: Endpoint
properties.help: The new endpoint of the bot. Must start with "https://".

properties.name: Sku

properties.name: AiApiKey
properties.help: Azure Application Insights API Key used to read bot analytics data. Provide a key if you want to view analytics about your bot in the Analytics blade.

properties.name: AiAppId
properties.help: Azure Application Insights Application ID used to read bot analytics data. Provide an Id if you want to view analytics about your bot in the Analytics blade.

properties.name: AiKey
properties.help: Azure Application Insights Key used to write bot analytics data. Provide a key if you want to receive bot analytics.
